document.docAuthor: Brescovit, Antonio D., Ruiz, Alexander Sánchez & Garcia, Giraldo Alayón
document.docTitle: Antilloides Brescovit, Ruiz & Garcia, 2016, new genus
document.masterDocTitle: The Filistatidae in the Caribbean region, with a description of the new genus Antilloides, revision of the genus Filistatoides F. O. P. - Cambridge and notes on Kukulcania Lehtinen (Arachnida, Araneae)

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: The Filistatidae in the Caribbean region, with a description of the new genus Antilloides, revision of the genus Filistatoides F. O. P. - Cambridge and notes on Kukulcania Lehtinen (Arachnida, Araneae)

subSubSection.paragraph: Etymology. The generic name is a contraction of Antilles plus “oides”, and is neuter in gender.

Diagnosis . Males of
Antilloides
can be distinguished from other American Prithinae by the tibia with two-three strong, distally rhomboid spines on a projected area (
Figs 9 C
,
11 A, D‒E
) and the cymbium is elongate distally and is approximately the length of the embolus (
Fig. 16 C‒F
). Females can be distinguished from other Prithinae by the genitalia having an anterior, elongated uterus externus (
Fig. 9 F
) and one pair of spermathecae with narrow and sinuous necks on the border of the cuticular fold (
Figs 17
F, 20 C).
Distribution . Greater Antilles: Cuba , Hispaniola, Puerto Rico and Lesser Antilles: Virgin Islands .
